other_tests.findings: Frequent bursts of a frontally predominant, 2-Hz spike and slow-wave discharges; slight background slowing of theta waves.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Frequency of spike–wave activity increased with sleep.

other_tests.findings: Poorly demarcated, periventricular band-like signal bilaterally; slight prominence of ventricles, cisterns, and sulci.
Clear, colorless fluid; Cells: 2 (1 red cell, 1 lymphocyte); Glucose: 68 mg/dl; Protein: 17 mg/dl.

other_tests.procedure_name: Biopsy of Left Quadriceps Muscle and Sural Nerve
other_tests.findings: Slight variation in size of myofibers with increased lysosomal activity; ultrastructural examination revealed membrane-bound curvilinear bodies and lamellar membranous bodies.
Granular deposits and curvilinear bodies within cells tentatively identified as macrophages.
Attenuated responses to stimulation consistent with advanced diffuse retinal degenerations affecting cone photoreceptor function.
Central conduction time of 9 msec; N19–P22 amplitude of 20 and 30 µV (on left and right-sided stimulation, respectively).
